titlestmt.titleproper: Commonwealth Fund records, Women's Health Program, SG 1, Series 38
A Guide to the Commonwealth Fund records, Women's Health Program, SG 1, Series 38 FA782

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-09-02 19:52:07 -0400.

did.unittitle: Commonwealth Fund records, Women's Health Program, SG 1, Series 38

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: RAC has legal title, copyright and literary rights to the material in so far it holds them. RAC may grant permission to publish.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Commonwealth Fund collection was donated to the RAC in 1985. Records in this series were transferred to the RAC by Commonwealth Fund in 1999.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Commonwealth Fund was established in 1918 with an endowment of $10 million from Mrs. Stephen V. Harkness for "benevolent, religious, educational and like purposes." The early grants supported a variety of programs while generally promoting welfare, especially child welfare. Several grants were made in the field of medical research, but the Board of Directors decided in 1920 that this field was already sufficiently supported by other philanthropic organizations.

Despite this decision, by the mid-1920s the chief interest of the Fund had become public health, including mental hygiene, community health, rural hospitals, medical research, and medical education. Other grant areas included war relief, educational and legal research, child welfare, and international medical fellowships.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Significant records in this series include the Adolescent Girls Health Study of 1997 and the Commonwealth Fund's second Women's Study of 1999.

The series also contains Women's Health Program staff files including program staff administrative documentation of select grants from 1994-1999, as well as associated symposiums, briefings and select Commission on Women's Health meetings.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.
